PathOfBuilding.Notes:
^xC8C8C8^7LEVELING GUIDE:^7^7
We're starting as a ^x70FF70Splitting Steel^7 Scion, using Physical Damage, so we wouldn't need to respec tree later (and also because ^x70FF70Splitting Steel^7 is a really solid ^xFFFF77Act 1^7 skill). We're switching to ^xE05030Exsanguinate^7 at level 12. Low Life version switches to Low Life after campaign
IMPORTANT LEAGUESTART GEARING INFO:
Weapons for ^x70FF70Splitting Steel^7: The best weapons will be ^xB97123^xE05030two-handed Axes^7^7, followed by ^xE05030two-handed Swords^7 - it is important to use two-handed weapons, as the base damage is far greater than the one-handed versions. If able, use the recipe: Melee Weapon + ^x8888FFMagic^7/^xFFFF77Rare^7 Rustic Sash + Blacksmith's Whetstone = ^x8888FFMagic^7 Melee Weapon with "^x8888FFHeavy^7" (Magic Belt) or "^x8888FFSerrated^7" (Rare Belt) prefix
Weapons for ^xE05030Exsanguinate^7: At the beginning of the game look for ^x8888FF+1 to Level of All Physical Spell Skill Gems^7 on ^x8888FF^x7070FFWands^7^7/^x7070FF^xE05030Sceptres^7^7/^x7070FF^x70FF70Rune Daggers^7^7/^x7070FF^xC8C8C8Shields^7^7. It will be the easiest to get at the very start (ilvl2 requirement for the mod). If you won't get it, use the recipe: Caster Weapon + ^x8888FFMagic^7/^xFFFF77Rare^7 Chain Belt + Blacksmith's Whetstone = ^x8888FFMagic^7 Caster Weapon with "^x8888FFApprentice's^7" (^x8888FFmagic^7 Belt) or "^x8888FFAdept's^7" (^xFFFF77rare^7 Belt) prefix We can choose between ^x7070FFWands^7, ^xE05030Sceptres^7 and ^x70FF70Rune Daggers^7 (two of a kind or with a ^xC8C8C8Shield^7). ^x7070FFWands^7 give us the best implicit, but they come with the highest ^x7070FFIntelligence^7 requirement, so it would be easier to go to ^xE05030Sceptres^7 or ^x70FF70Rune Daggers^7 later. Ideally we would run low-base ^x7070FFWands^7 while leveling. Mods on caster weapons such as "^x8888FFAdds # to # Fire Damage to Spells^7" can help us in the short time, but won't scale us further, as we will lean towards a physical DoT side of ^xE05030Exsanguinate^7.
Gearing early: Even though we would ideally run ^xE05030Armour^7/^x70FF70Evasion^7 gear, it is better and easier to start with ^xE05030Armour^7 or ^xE05030Armour^7/^x7070FFEnergy Shield^7 bases. Change to ^xE05030Armour^7/^x70FF70Evasion^7 bases once you have enough chromes and jewellers to get the right socket colours (which would probably be in early maps).
^xFFFF77ACT I^7:
After beating Hillock (^xADAA47Enemy at the Gate^7) take ^x70FF70Splitting Steel^7 from ^xADAA47Tarkleigh^7. After delivering Medicine Chest (^xADAA47Mercy Mission^7) take ^xE05030Chance to Bleed Support^7 and ^x8888FF^xC8C8C8Quicksilver Flask^7^7 from Nessa. You want to link ^x70FF70Splitting Steel^7 with ^xE05030Chance to Bleed Support^7 (^x70FF70G^7^xE05030R^7) After opening the Submerged Passage (^xADAA47Breaking Some Eggs^7) take ^x70FF70^x8888FF^x7070FFFrostblink^7^7^7 from ^xADAA47Tarkleigh^7. If you can, buy ^xE05030War Banner^7 and ^xE05030Steelskin^7 from ^xADAA47Nessa^7. After killing Brutus (^xADAA47The Caged Brute^7), take ^x7070FFFlame Dash^7 and replace ^x7070FFFrostblink^7 with it. If you can, buy ^xE05030Enduring Cry^7, ^xE05030Vitality^7 and ^x7070FFEfficacy Support^7 (Efficacy for the future use with Exsanguinate) from ^xADAA47Nessa^7. If you need damage and have 3-link, you can buy ^xC8C8C8Added^7 ^xE05030Fire^7/^x70FF70Cold^7/^x7070FFLightning^7 ^xC8C8C8Damage Support^7, based on your links. You can also start buying ^xE05030Lifetap Support^7s to change Mana Cost of skills to Life Cost of skills, which will be easier to sustain. After entering The Cavern of Wrath (^xADAA47The Siren's Cadence^7), take ^xE05030Exsanguinate^7 from ^xADAA47Nessa^7 and switch to it - we will now use ^xE05030Exsanguinate^7 - ^x7070FFEfficacy Support^7 (^xE05030R^7^x7070FFB^7). From now on you want to link all your skills except for Auras and ^xE05030Exsanguinate^7 with ^xE05030Lifetap Support^7s - this will simplify our playstyle, as we can completely ignore mana regeneration issues. Details in the 'Skills' section in PoB. You may struggle with ^x7070FFIntelligence^7 early on - you can solve it by buying Lapis Amulet from ^xADAA47Nessa^7.
Skill/respec points: Book of Skill (one passive point) - ^xADAA47The Dweller of the Deep^7 Book of Skill - ^xADAA47The Marooned Mariner^7 Book of Skill - ^xADAA47The Way Forward^7 (keep in mind you will complete this quest in ^xFFFF77Act 2^7, and then you need to come back to ^xADAA47Lioneye's Watch^7 to claim the reward from ^xADAA47Bestel^7).
Trials of Ascendancy: Lower Prison (spike traps)
Other quests: ^xADAA47A Dirty Job^7 (optional - grants Book of Regrets (two Respec Points))
^xFFFF77ACT II^7:
It doesn't really matter which gem you'll take from ^xADAA47Greust^7 after completing ^xADAA47Intruders in Black^7 - none of them is relevant to us. However, after the ^xADAA47Intruders in Black^7 quest you will be able to buy ^xE05030Herald of Purity^7 from ^xADAA47Yeena^7. Buy it if you can. Remember to complete ^xADAA47The Way Forward^7 quest and to collect your skill point from ^xADAA47Bestel^7 (^xADAA47Lioneye's Watch^7 - ^xFFFF77Act 1^7) After killing The Weaver (^xADAA47Sharp and Cruel^7) take ^xE05030Cruelty Support^7 from ^xADAA47Silk^7. If you can afford it AND you already have a proper 4-link, buy ^x7070FFControlled Destruction Support^7 from ^xADAA47Yeena^7. At this point you'd have these sockets: ^xE05030RR^7^x7070FFB^7(^x7070FFB^7) - ^xE05030Exsanguinate^7 - ^xE05030Cruelty Support^7 - ^x7070FFEfficacy Support^7 - (^x7070FFControlled Destruction Support^7) ^xFFFF77^xADAA47^xADAA47^7Complete^7^7 ^xADAA47Deal with the Bandits^7^7^7 quest by killing all bandits (Oak, Alira and Kraityn) and claim two skill points from ^xADAA47Eramir^7.
Skill/respec points: Eramir's Favour (two Skill Points received automatically while talking with ^xADAA47Eramir^7) - ^xADAA47Deal with the Bandits^7 Book of Regrets - ^xADAA47Through Sacred Ground^7
Trial of Ascendancy: The Crypt Level 1 (hovering sawblades) The Chamber of Sins Level 2 (floor sawblades)
Other quests: You will encounter Einhar and get a quest with introduction - you can ignore it for now. The questline ^xADAA47The Great White Beast^7 - ^xADAA47Through Sacred Ground^7 is optional.
^xFFFF77ACT III^7:
After fighting Piety (^xADAA47Lost in Love^7) take ^xE05030Vulnerability^7 from ^xADAA47Maramoa^7. As mentioned in the Act 1 section, ideally you'd want this to be linked with ^xE05030Lifetap Support^7 to simplify mana issues and reservation values. If able, buy ^xE05030Pride^7 from ^x7070FFClarissa^7. You want to switch ^xE05030Herald of Purity^7 for ^xE05030Pride^7. We won't be able to reserve both until a bit later. After meeting with Lady Dialla (^xADAA47The Gemling Queen/The Ribbon Spool/Fiery Dust^7 questline) take the amulet based on the attribute you have issues with (most likely ^x7070FFLapis Amulet^7 for the extra ^x7070FFIntelligence^7 or ^x70FF70Jade Amulet^7 for extra ^x70FF70Dexterity^7). After killing General Gravicius (^xADAA47Sever the Right Hand^7), there isn't any required gem to get as a reward.
Skills/respec points: Book of Skill - ^xADAA47Victario's Secrets^7 Book of Skill - ^xADAA47Piety's Pets^7
Trial of Ascendancy: The Crematorium (furnace traps) The Catacombs (blade sentries) The Imperial Gardens (dart traps)
Other quests: ^xADAA47A Swig of Hope^7 can grant you ^xFFFF77rare Ring^7 - it is probably too tedious to complete though. ^xADAA47A Fixture of Fate^7 - we have to do it, so that we can earn ^xE05030Arrogance Support^7 from ^xADAA47Siosa^7.
^xFFFF77ACT IV^7:
After using Deshret's Banner (^xADAA47Breaking the Seal^7) take ^xE05030Summon Stone Golem^7. It will help us with Life Regeneration, so that we will be able to use our skills more freely. We will be dropping it later, but it is helpful at that stage. Complete ^xADAA47the Normal Labirynth^7 after claiming the waypoint in ^xADAA47Crystal Veins^7. After killing Malachai and the Beast (^xADAA47The Eternal Nightmare^7), take ^x70FF70Chain Support^7 (improving clear with Exsanguinate). If you can, buy ^x7070FFArcanist Brand^7 and link it to ^xE05030Vulnerability^7 to automate the curse. You may now buy ^xE05030Brutality Support^7 if you have sockets to fit it.
Now your Exsanguinate links should look like this:
MAIN: ^xE05030Exsanguinate^7 - ^x7070FFEfficacy Support^7 - ^xE05030Cruelty Support^7 - ^x7070FFControlled Destruction Support^7 - (^xE05030Brutality Support^7) - (^x70FF70Chain Support^7) (^xE05030R^7^x7070FFB^7^xE05030R^7^x7070FFB^7(^xE05030R^7^x70FF70G^7)) (you will likely have a 4-link at this point, so Brutality and Chain are in brackets as an upgrade when you get 5- and 6-link)
Skill/respec points: Book of Skill - ^xADAA47An Indomitable Spirit^7
^xFFFF77ACT V^7:
After slaying Overseer Krow (^xADAA47Return to Oriath^7) take a ^xFFFF77rare Ring^7 from ^xADAA47Lani^7 - prioritise the base that will help with your lowest ^xC8C8C8Resistance^7. After killing Justicar Casticus (^xADAA47The Key to Freedom^7) take either ^x7070FFJade Flask^7 or ^x8888FFGranite Flask^7 - both will be amazing for defenses. After killing High Templar Avarius (^xADAA47Death to Purity^7) take ^xE05030Crimson Jewel^7 (we want %life, %global phys, %inc Dot, %DoT Multi, %Physical DoT Multi - there is a high chance this jewel would be useless for us)
Skill/respec points: Book of Skill - ^xADAA47In Service of Science^7 Book of Skill - ^xADAA47Kitava's Torments^7
Other quests: Killing ^xADAA47Utula^7 (^xADAA47The King's Feast^7) grants a rare weapon - neither of them interests us.
^xFFFF77ACT VI^7:
After clearing Twilight Strand (^xADAA47Fallen from Grace^7), take the Book of Regrets from ^xADAA47Lilly Roth^7. She will sell you all the available gems. From her you can buy ^xE05030Arrogance Support^7, which you will link with ^xE05030Vitality^7, so that it is reserved on your Life instead of your Mana. You should be able to reserve ^xE05030War Banner^7, ^xE05030Herald of Purity^7, ^xE05030Pride^7 and one other 50% Aura (you can choose between ^xE05030Determination^7 (armour), ^x70FF70Grace^7 (evasion) and ^x7070FFMalevolence^7 (more damage and skill effect duration)).
GEM OVERVIEW:
MAIN: ^xE05030Exsanguinate^7 - ^x7070FFEfficacy Support^7 - ^xE05030Cruelty Support^7 - ^x7070FFControlled Destruction Support^7 - (^xE05030Brutality Support^7) - (^x70FF70Chain Support^7) (^xE05030R^7^x7070FFB^7^xE05030R^7^x7070FFB^7(^xE05030R^7^x70FF70G^7)) MANA AURAS: ^xE05030War Banner^7 - ^xE05030Herald of Purity^7 - ^xE05030Pride^7 - ^xE05030Determination^7/^x70FF70Grace^7/^x7070FFMalevolence^7 LIFE AURAS: ^xE05030Vitality^7 - ^xE05030Arrogance^7 CURSE: ^xE05030Vulnerability^7 - ^xE05030^x7070FFArcanist Brand^7^7 - ^xE05030Lifetap Support^7 MOVEMENT/UTILITY: ^x7070FFFlame Dash^7 - ^xE05030Steelskin^7 - ^xE05030Enduring Cry^7 - ^xE05030Lifetap Support^7 OTHERS: ^xE05030Summon Stone Golem^7
From now on complete the quests and trials, collect points, receive rewards, complete Labirynths.
^xADAA47^xFFFF77LABYRINTH/ASCENDANCY ORDER^7^7:
Normal Labyrinth (Level ~33, start of Act 4): 'Strength and Intelligence', and 'Passive Point', leading to the Templar. Cruel Labyrinth (Level ~55, start of Act 8): 'Hierophant' and 'Passive Point', leading to Path of the Templar. Merciless Labyrinth (Level ~67, end of Act 10): 'Path of the Templar' and 'Strength and Dexterity', leading to the Duelist. Uber Lab (Level ~75, yellow maps): 'Passive Point' and 'Gladiator'.
^xFFFF77PANTHEON^7:
Major: Soul of the Brine King (Stun "Immunity" and Freeze Immunity) Minor: choose based on the content you're doing.
^xFFFF77SWITCH TO LOWLIFE^7:
The guide is set up to transition the character to Low Life at the end of the campaign. We will then start reserving ^xE05030Petrified Blood^7 to patch up the Life loss from reservation - see the proper 'Skills' set. Keep in mind - although it is a big chunk of damage thanks to Pain Attunement, it is also a decrease in survivability. You can stay with previous auras and not go Low Life if you prefer. There is a version of tree/skills/gear, designed to lean to survivability. You can go that way if you prefer.
^xFFFF77EXSANGUINATE VS REAP^7:
The guide suggests using both Exsanguinate and Reap at the endgame. The idea is to use Exsanguinate and Chain Support for clear and Reap with Swift Affliction for bosses. In theory Reap does less damage than Exsanguinate with three stages, but in practice Reap feels much better in boss fights, because you have to press it once, and both spells have long cast time. While leveling I'd advise to stick with Exsanguinate - it should be enough damage, and it is available earlier (Exsanguinate is available from level 12, Reap - from level 28). Specific gem links are in the 'Skills' section of the PoB.
